chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Singer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Huber privileges.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------------

miscConds.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victims(s) without victim's and Probation Agent's consent.
----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations, which was completed prior to sentencing.
----------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel J Singer in court with attorney David A Danz.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Daniel J Singer in court with attorney David A Danz.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have an agreement. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Defendant Daniel J Singer in court with attorney David A Danz.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Daniel J Singer in court with attorney David A Danz.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH DET. ROBERT CRAIG OR BRANDON DANOWSKI OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL THRU THEIR EMPLOYMENT AS LAW OFFICERS. NO CONTACT WITH ALPINE VALLEY.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. RE: 15-2800 thru 15-2802
Defendant in court, in custody with Atty David Malkus and Rebecca Hammock. Tracy McMiller appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
